title: 110_s1582
content: The Act may be cited as the "Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Amendments of 2008". Definitions are provided in the Act. Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892) is amended to define 'hydrographic data' as information acquired through various surveying methods and 'hydrographic services' as the management and dissemination of bathymetric and hydrographic data. The curr_chunk defines hydrographic services as the management, maintenance, interpretation, certification, and dissemination of various types of information related to bathymetry, hydrography, geodesy, geospatial data, geomagnetism, tides, water levels, and currents, including the production of nautical charts and databases. It also includes the development of nautical information systems and related activities. The curr_chunk defines the functions of the Administrator. The Administrator's functions are defined in Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998, which includes promoting safe marine transportation and providing hydrographic services. The Administrator may procure, operate vessels and equipment for safe navigation, design real-time monitoring systems, acquire hydrographic data for conservation, and provide services to save lives and property. The Administrator may acquire hydrographic data, provide services to save lives and property, support commerce resumption in emergencies, create joint centers with other agencies, and award contracts for data acquisition. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel consisting of 15 voting members appointed by the Administrator. The panel will also include nonvoting members from the Center for Coastal and Ocean Mapping/Joint Hydrographic Center and NOAA. Voting members must be qualified in disciplines related to hydrographic data, marine transportation, port administration, and other relevant fields. Authorization of appropriations is also included in the amendment. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel with voting and nonvoting members. Section 306 is amended to authorize appropriations. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel with voting and nonvoting members. Authorization for appropriations is provided for nautical mapping, charting functions, and hydrographic surveys for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel with voting and nonvoting members. Authorization for appropriations is provided for nautical mapping, charting functions, hydrographic surveys, geodetic functions, tide and current measurement functions, and acquisition of a replacement hydrographic survey vessel for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel with voting and nonvoting members. Authorization for appropriations is provided for nautical mapping, charting functions, hydrographic surveys, geodetic functions, tide and current measurement functions, and acquisition of a replacement hydrographic survey vessel for fiscal years 2009 to 2012, with specific funding amounts allocated for each year. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED NOAA CORPS STRENGTH. The total number of authorized commissioned officers in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps shall be increased from 321 to 379, subject to certain conditions being met.
